com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation

Class LongOperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.core.notifications.NotifierImpl
      • com.samysadi.acs.core.tracing.ProbedImpl
        • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.EntityImpl
          • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.RunnableEntityImpl
            • com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation.OperationImpl<Resource>
              • com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation.LongOperationImpl<Resource>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity, RunnableEntity, Notifier, Probed, Operation<Resource>, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComputingOperationDefault, NetworkOperationDefault, StorageOperationDefault, TimerOperation

    public abstract class LongOperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>
extends OperationImpl<Resource>
    This class defines a Operation that uses a LongResource.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

    • Constructor Detail

      • LongOperationImpl

        public LongOperationImpl()
        Empty constructor that creates a zero-length operation.

        This constructor is provided only to satisfy the Entity contract. You should use LongOperationImpl(long) though.

      • LongOperationImpl

        public LongOperationImpl(long operationLength)
        Parameters:
        operationLength - a long value indicating the length of this operation, needs to be strictly positive

        The clone will contain a new empty listeners list and is independent from this object.

      • getLength

        public long getLength()
        Returns the length of this operation.
        Returns:
        the length of this operation

      • getResourceMax

        public long getResourceMax()
        Returns the maximum resource value that this operation can use (inclusive).

        On activation, this operation will ask the provisioner to grant at most a value equals to this value, even if this operation receives a promise greater than this value.

        Default is Long.MAX_VALUE.

        For resources that needs a unit of time (to represent bandwidth, transfer rates etc..), the value returned here is assumed to be the maximum length that can be operated in one Simulator.SECOND.

        Returns:
        the maximum resource value that this operation can use (inclusive)

      • setResourceMax

        public void setResourceMax(long resourceMax)
        Updates the maximum resource that can be granted for this operation.

        For resources that needs a unit of time (to represent bandwidth, transfer rates etc..), the value set here is assumed to be the maximum length that can be operated in one Simulator.SECOND.

        Parameters:
        resourceMax -
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this operation is activated

      • getResourceMin

        public long getResourceMin()
        Returns the minimum resource value that this operation needs for activation (inclusive).

        On activation, if this operation receives a smaller promise than this value from the provisioner, then the activation fails.

        Default is 1l.

        For resources that needs a unit of time (to represent bandwidth, transfer rates etc..), the value returned here is assumed to be the minimum length that can be operated in one Simulator.SECOND.

        Returns:
        the minimum resource value that this operation needs for activation (inclusive)

      • setResourceMin

        public void setResourceMin(long resourceMin)
        Updates the minimum resource that has to be granted for this operation on activation.

        For resources that needs a unit of time (to represent bandwidth, transfer rates etc..), the value set here is assumed to be the minimum length that can be operated in one Simulator.SECOND.

        Parameters:
        resourceMin -
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this operation is activated

      • getTotalRunningTime

        public long getTotalRunningTime()
        Description copied from interface: Operation
        Returns the total accumulated simulation time when this operation was running.
        Returns:
        the total accumulated simulation time when this operation was running

      • getCompletedLength

        public long getCompletedLength()
        Returns the completed length of this operation. If this operation is active then this does not include the completed length since last activation.
        Returns:
        the completed length of this operation

      • getRemainingDelay

        public long getRemainingDelay()
        Description copied from interface: Operation
        Returns the delay remaining until the end of this operation using the current allocated resources.

        If the operation is running, the returned value takes into account the progress made during current activation.

        Returns:
        the delay remaining until the end of this operation using the current allocated resources

      • doStart

        public void doStart()
        Description copied from class: OperationImpl
        Activate the current operation. These basic steps are taken:
        • Allocates the wanted resource on each Provisioner that is related to this operation;
        • Updates this operation state and schedules an event for the end of operation to automatically deactivate it when it is completed.
        The new operation state is set to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.RUNNING if successful or to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.FAILED if the operation cannot be activated (example: not enough resources).
        Specified by:
        doStart in interface RunnableEntity
        Specified by:
        doStart in class OperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>

      • doPause

        public void doPause()
        Description copied from class: OperationImpl
        Pauses the current operation. These basic steps are taken:
        • Frees the allocated resource on each Provisioner that is related to this operation;
        • Updates this operation state and discards any scheduled event during operation activation;
        • Updates total completed length, and sets the operation state to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.COMPLETED if needed.
        The new Operation state is set to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.PAUSED or to RunnableEntity.RunnableState.COMPLETED.

        Specified by:
        doPause in interface RunnableEntity
        Specified by:
        doPause in class OperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>

      • doRestart

        public void doRestart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Reinitializes the entity and restarts it from the beginning.

        Use this method to start again an entity after it is terminated. So, unlike RunnableEntity.doStart() this method will not throw an exception if this entity is already terminated.

        Make sure that RunnableEntity.canRestart() returns true before calling this method or you will get an exception.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must be canceled.

        Specified by:
        doRestart in interface RunnableEntity
        Specified by:
        doRestart in class OperationImpl<Resource extends LongResource>
